Package info.kuechler.bmf.taxcalculator

Interface Accessor<K,​T extends Calculator<T>>

  • Type Parameters:
    K - the key type
    T - the Calculator type
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    AccessorImpl
    public interface Accessor<K,​T extends Calculator<T>>
    Accessor interface to simple handle of setter and getter from Calculator instances.
    • There are four methods to set values: set(Object, Object), setInt(Object, int), setDouble(Object, double) and setBigDecimal(Object, BigDecimal).
    • There are four methods to get values: get(Object), getInt(Object), getDouble(Object) and getBigDecimal(Object).
    • There are two methods to get the types: getInputsWithType() and getOutputsWithType(). Calling the methods do not change the instance.
    • There is a method to reset all values: setAllToZero(). With this method you can set all internal values in the initial state.
    • There is a method method to get the original Calculator instance: getCalculator().
    • There is a method to get the special type for output values: getOutputSpecialType(Object).
    Since:
    2018.0.0

    • Method Detail

      • newMap

        static <V> Map<String,​V> newMap()
        Creates a new Map for constructor input. Map uses the keys in a case-insensitive manner. Static way to using before create an instance for use as a constructor parameter.
        Type Parameters:
        V - the value type
        Returns:
        a new created Map

      • createValueMap

        @Deprecated
default <V> Map<String,​V> createValueMap()
        Deprecated.
        use newMap(), since 2022.0.0, forRemoval=true
        Creates a new Map for Accessor data. I.e. you can use the same key Comparator like the original Maps.
        Type Parameters:
        V - the value type
        Returns:
        a new created Map

      • set

        <V> void set​(K key,
             V value)
        Set a value. The value will be converted into BigDecimal, int or double.

        Be sure that you are already using the correct type or choose a type so that the value can be converted without loss. For correct target type see getInputsWithType().

        Conversion
        Target Type Source Type Conversion
        int Number Number.intValue()
        double Number Number.doubleValue()
        BigDecimal BigDecimal -
        BigInteger BigInteger bi = (BigInteger) value;
        new BigDecimal(bi)
        Integer
        Byte
        Short
        AtomicInteger        		 int i = ((Number) value).intValue();
        new BigDecimal(i);
        Long
        AtomicLong        		 long l = ((Number) value).longValue();
        new BigDecimal(l);
        Double
        Float        		 double d = ((Number) value).doubleValue();
        new BigDecimal(d);
        another Number object throws IllegalArgumentException
        ... not a Number throws IllegalArgumentException
        Type Parameters:
        V - value object class
        Parameters:
        key - the key
        value - the value
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if key is null or key unknown
        NullPointerException - if value is null

      • setAllToZero

        void setAllToZero()
        Set all values to 0, 0.0 or BigDecimal.ZERO.

      • getInputsWithType

        Map<K,​Class<?>> getInputsWithType()
        Get all inputs with type Class. The type can be BigDecimal, int.class or double.class.

        implNote: the map is copied before returning it, Map uses the keys in a case-insensitive manner

        Returns:
        Map

      • getOutputsWithType

        Map<K,​Class<?>> getOutputsWithType()
        Get all outputs with type. The type can be BigDecimal, int.class or double.class.

        implNote: the map is copied before returning it, Map uses the keys in a case-insensitive manner

        Returns:
        Map

        Returns:
        the key
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if key is null or key unknown

      • getCalculator

        T getCalculator()

        the calculator
